The hostess doesn't care, she just walks off. I hand the bill from the previous party that at at our table to a passing waitress and clean the table off. Our waiter comes and first thing he asks for is the bill of the previous party and I tell him I handed it off to a waitress. He looks upset and sternly asked me which one and at that point I let him have it for everthing I had mentioned before. So we order our drinks and because I hate waiting to get a refill, I ask him to bring me two drinks at once. He forgets a drink of someone else at my party but brings my second one. When the food comes, I specifically ask for ranch with my food and guess what, no ranch. At this point I just call it a wash and ask for my bill. I read over it and I get charged for two separate drinks when the one I had was free refills. Oh well, cheap price to pay to learn to never go through that agian.

Not giving 5 stars because the sweet waitstaff were showing their frustration at the crowd (there was a line just to put your name in!), and I say this after having worked in food service, so I know busy and I know tired. I also know that when you make the customer feel bad for asking for something (the little reservation buzzy thingy), that's bad business and not good service. Now that that is out of way: HOLY WOW. The food. AMAZING. The setting: sublime. I felt like it shouldn't be called "The Cheesecake Factory" but rather, the "Divine Food Castle!" The Cerritos, California location is so beautiful, I just about died. It's just as dreamy as it could possibly be. My hat is off to the designers. It's like an art deco dream in there. And the food! OMG. My food was lovely, my partner's food was fantastic. Our server, while blind in one eye, did a wonderful job of making us feel welcome, understood and cared for. He was such a delightful young man. It was a total dining experience and I will be back. I think this is my new favorite place!

We went last night for my daughter's birthday it was pretty busy for a Wednesday it was about a 45 min wait which we didnt mind because the mall was open. Once we were seated in the patio it was nicely cozy with the heaters and perfect for a cold night. Our waitress was very nice and attentive her name was Monica the rest of our visit was great our food came out hot and tasty besides my son complaining about the mere 4 tiny pieces of chicken in his huge plate of Alfredo that cost $20 we were satisfied with our visit it was a good night for this location

location: South Los Angeles, Los Angeles, CA
review: It was my first time coming here and it was finneee, i wouldnt say im dying to come back. The waiter we had was great! He would come check up on us often but after said he had to leave and left us with another waiter. Which i cant say i was impressed with. She only asked if we were ok once and after never came back. Later, our first waiter came and asked if we wanted refills and fresh bread. Me and my boyfriend both agree he was great. Now, food was good, the dumpling appetizers were very salty but the avocado appetizers were delicious. As for the main meal, (chicken mushroom pasta, and brisket burger i believe.) the portions are quite big for one person. We took both dishes to go and plates were practically full. Had 100 dollar gift card and spent 75 total so i just tipped our first waiter the 25 that was left. Nice place, but unless i get another gc i dont think i'd go again anytime soon.

It's a shame that the taste of their food and their customer service are polar opposites. The food was delicious even though they got our orders wrong. His order did not have the crusted chicken . I asked if my order had mushroom and he said "no". I thought awesome, because I hate mushrooms. I feel sorry for anyone that wanted mushrooms that night, because I got all of them. Whatever easy fix, I shoveled them all onto another plate. I thought the hour wait was bad, the last 30 minutes we waited for our server to come give us our check was worse. Luckily another server named Felipe saw our lost faces and bagged our food and gave us our checks. But oh man that other guy. For the rest of this survey, we'll call him Trashlipe. It was our second time being helped out by Trashlipe and his service was just terrible. In all, great food but definitely eat inside instead of the patio, even if it's faster!

Cheesecake Factory at Cerritos is an good spot. But today my experience was not so great. We ordered a few items and towards the end of our meal my mom took a bite out of the salmon and noticed something itching her upper lip. She found out it was a piece of hair.  Wasn't expecting them to take it off our check. So we asked for our check then reported it our waiter and seems like the waiter did not report to the kitchen or management. Highly disappointed.  Need to better train the staff
Every time I come here the service is terrible. Expect long waits to be seated and your glass to be empty.
